content: k11 m1 k to end 52 sts rounds 19 & 20 knit the thumb knit 14 stitches these are the thumb stitches transfer the rest of the stitches to a spare needle using the backward loop method cast on four more stitches knit 14 then the four new stitches again 18 sts knit 16 rounds or until the thumb is about 0 5 cm / ¼ less than your finished thumb length if you try the mitten on the mitten thumb should come about halfway up your thumb nail next round *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 12 sts next round knit next round *k2tog repeat from * to end 6 sts cut the yarn thread it through the remaining six stitches and fasten_off the hand knit the stitches from the spare needle and then at the end of the round pick up and knit eight stitches from the base of the thumb 46 sts knit 12 rounds or until your mitten reaches the bottom of the first finger on your hand using the backward loop method cast on two more stitches the finger put the first 32 stitches of the round on a stitch holder leaving you with 16 stitches for the finger knit those 16 stitches dividing them so that you can knit in the round knit 20 rounds or until the finger is 0 5 cm / ¼ less than your finished finger length the mitten finger should reach to about halfway up the finger nail next round *k2 k2tog repeat from * to end 12 sts next round knit next round *k2tog repeat from * to end 6 sts cut the yarn thread it through the remaining six stitches and fasten_off finishing the hand starting in the middle of the base of the finger pick up and knit three stitches knit the 32 stitches from the spare needle and then pick up and knit three more stitches from the base of the finger 38 sts next round knit next round ssk k to last 2 sts k2tog 36 sts knit 16 rounds or until the mitten is 2 5 cm / 1 shorter than your longest finger the top of the mitten is shaped over seven rounds round1 ssk k14 k2tog twice 32 sts round 2 knit round 3 ssk k12 k2tog twice 28 sts round 4 knit round 5 ssk k10 k2tog twice 24 sts round 6 knit round 7 *k2tog repeat from * to end 12 sts the remaining stitches are grafted together for a smooth seamless join arrange the stitches on two needles with six stitches on each hold the two needles together with the wool coming from the needle at the back needle b the needle in the front is needle a but then you probably guessed that cut the wool leaving a long end thread a blunt
